abstract: Pres Salva Kiir of South Sudan announces dissolution of country's 10 states and creation of 28 new ones; political opponents contend move threatens peace deal to end country's two-year civil war, which hinges on power-sharing arrangements made in original 10 states.
lead_paragraph: President Salva Kiir dissolved the country’s 10 states and created 28 new ones, a move critics say will threaten the peace deal signed in August.

headline.main: South Sudan: Creation of New States Draws Opposition Protests
headline.print_headline: South Sudan: Creation of New States Draws Protests From the Opposition

snippet: President Salva Kiir dissolved the country’s 10 states and created 28 new ones, a move critics say will threaten the peace deal signed in August.
